summary: Simon, re: user's reaction to the tool

summary: Simon, re: Model Importing
mainText: 'You could 3D scan a city, a dog, yourself!'

summary: Simon, re: Model Importing
mainText: 'We are having way too much fun working on Hytale! I don‚Äôt even know what‚Äôs going on with creative tools anymore I just let Ktar go crazy üòÖ'

summary: Hytale shares video of new Model Importing tool
mainText:
'We've just added a fun feature to our creative tools: model importing! üîß
Can't wait to see all the crazy builds you do with it! #Hytale'

summary: Slikey, re: empowering servers with creative sound design mechanics
mainText: 'Can you give me examples? Hytale supports custom sounds and music in mods, so you can have your own SFX on servers and use them on your server within custom logic, ambience and music etc.'

summary: Slikey, re: approval for Mac
mainText: 'You have to do the same thing for Windows. The process makes sense but Microsoft made it easy for us to get the certification while Apple leaves us waiting.'

summary: Simon, re: user drafting long list of ideas, wanting to share with Hytale Team
mainText: 'Save your ideas for when the game comes out, so you will be able to adjust'

summary: Simon, re: dropping materials when going thru gateways
mainText: 'Not for exploration mode, subject to change though'

summary: Simon, re: user asking for teleportation system
mainText: 'We have teleportation gateways in exploration mode, like Valheim'

summary: Simon, re: Prowl saying it must be a crazy thing to juggle
mainText: 'I will do whats most fun for us first and adjust over time! We are in this for the long haul'

summary: Simon, re: user saying everyone wants different experiences - focus and do your best
mainText: 'yeah lol'

summary: Simon, re: user concerned Hytale is focusing too much on RPG
mainText:
'brother, living world / core gameplay first

dungeons/etc much later

replayability is critical'

summary: Simon, re: modders making Hardcore mode in meantime
mainText: 'Yep'

summary: Simon, re: Hardcore mode
mainText: 'When the game is stable in far future lol'

summary: Simon, re: potential Peaceful mode function
mainText: 'yeah, make them neutral unless attacked first'

summary: Simon, re: user saying some people don't want hostile mobs
mainText:
'We are planning dungeons, boss fights, quests and other challenges that involve a lot of hostile monsters though.

This is not Minecraft üòÖ'

summary: Simon, re: Olegro suggesting reduced health, no signature moves, etc.
mainText: 'Yes'

summary: Simon, re: user asking for Hostile Mobs toggle
mainText: 'Some crafting is tied to mob drops, this is not minecraft'

summary: Simon, re: Prowl8413 saying a Peaceful mode will exist
mainText: 'I didn't say specifically they wouldn't have to deal with any hostile mobs, though; it's core to the gameplay! Maybe in the lowest setting, the hostile mobs would be trivial.'

summary: Simon, re: 'only Normal mode for now?'
mainText: 'Trying to add some settings in time, idk if we can make it'

summary: Simon, re: difficulty modes
mainText: 'not for release, planned eventually'

summary: Simon, re: suggestion to relax
mainText: 'Im chilling watching TV with the kids right now, tweeting is relaxing üòÖ'

summary: Simon, re: Hawkon using reverse psychology and saying he hates Prox Chat
mainText: 'Already got prototype working'

summary: Simon, re: user asking abt new videos
mainText: 'Caught bad case of influenza so Ive been saving my energy to work on the game, will do some videos after Christmas'

summary: Simon, re: user saying people just want to rile up the devs
mainText:
'Bro, if only they knew who I was, I will literally go harder when people hate üòÖ
I have bookmarks of tweets saying I couldn‚Äôt buy back Hytale üòÇ'

mainText:
'Lol! Well, candidly - we are getting lots of requests (which is INCREDIBLE!!). So if it's been a few days without a reply, please feel free to give me a poke on here ‚ù§Ô∏èü´°

summary: Buddha, re: JuzuLive bumping their Creator Code application
mainText: 'i gotchu üëç'

summary: Slikey, re: sharing Hytale builds unsigned to Mac users while waiting approval
mainText: 'That's what we currently have to do internally but obviously we would rather someone just click that approve button after we assembled all these documents for the Xth time.'

summary: Slikey, re: hosting servers Day One
mainText: 'Dedicated servers for self-hosters are available with the game download on day 1.'

summary: Slikey, re: doing a lot to ensure support on platforms with a small playerbase
mainText:
'Thank you! I think Mac is going to see a lot more demand in the future - the times have seriously changed and it would be foolish to ignore them as a games platform. I just wish they would make it less of a hassle.

People always ask and demand more - may appear annoying at times but I appreciate the pressure. Keeps me engaged and challenged to deliver more and better results.

And when it gets too much: "No." is a powerful statement ;)'

summary: Slikey, re: Mac support
mainText:
'The only thing holding back Mac support at this point is Apple's incredibly bloated and slow approval process for Code Signing and Notarization.
Given that holidays are coming up, I am not expecting to be able to confirm Mac support on launch day before End-Of-Year.'

mainText: 'It was never implemented I‚Äôm pretty sure, will do something similar post launch'

summary: Slikey, re: Molina asking if Hytale could have a pre-load
mainText: 'No pre-load. That would require more system to be built to decrypt downloads etc. We don't have capacity for it.'

summary: Slikey, re: potential for OAuth 2.0 system that external developers can use
mainText: 'Not for launch, we need to evaluate the use-cases and potential impact to privacy, child protection & security. We understand the value it would provide to third-party websites that want to offer out-of-game experiences.'

summary: Slikey, re: server plugin dev asking for information
